intro: Capnites roseopurpureus, commonly known as the purple-rose capnite, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, clustered umbels of white to pinkish flowers. The leaves are typically pinnately divided, with a delicate, feathery appearance. Native to southern Europe, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its ornamental value lies in its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
